dublinCore.dc:title: 119 SJ 23 IS: Providing for congressional disapproval of the proposed license amendment for the export to Israel of certain defense articles and services.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Sanders introduced the following joint resolution; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations

form.official-title: Providing for congressional disapproval of the proposed license amendment for the export to Israel of certain defense articles and services.

section.text: That the issuance of a license amendment to export with respect to the following proposed export to Israel is prohibited:

paragraph.text: The export of the following defense articles and defense services described in Transmittal No. DDTC 24â€“052, which was submitted to Congress pursuant to section 36(c) of the Arms Export Control Act (22 U.S.C. 2776(c)) and communication of which was published in the Congressional Record on February 10, 2025 (Executive Communication 337): Boeing Direct Attack Weapons (Joint Direct Attack Munition (JDAM) variants and Small Diameter Bomb (SDB) Increment I variants) for end-use by the Israeli Ministry of Defense. The amendment authorizes the transfer of 15,500 additional JDAM tail kits and an additional 615 SDBs to the Israeli Ministry of Defense.
